Articles.Content: Floor 4157: the NASA employee was revealed to be Scott Manley.

Floor 4158: a sign declaring NEW PAGE!

214008192023

Floor 4159: All walls are engraved with the number 19. Well, because if you add up all the digits of this floor, it adds up to 19!

It also has mangoes.

Floor 4160: a vault of broken dreams and lost hopes

043908212023
Floor 4161: An escape room full of clues and puzzles. You have 5 hours to work them all out and escape.

Floor 4162: the biggest oreo cookie, its 1344 light years across!

201808252023

Floor 4163:

Building snaps back to 'reality' with this floor. Normal cosmoscraper with office workers, a canteen, etc. Everyone seems to be working normally despite the 17km altitude. Strangely none of them seem to be aware of your existence or your disheveled appearance. You stealgrab some food and take a shower in one of the bathrooms. You try the lift. No luck. It doesn't acknowledge your existence. Downward staircase doesn't open. You continue  upwards for lack of anything to do. 

Edited August 26, 2023 by OrdinaryKerman
Floor 4164: Fun park with lots to do.

Floor 4165: a table. On this table is a container. In this container are Lincoln logs.

220508252023
Floor 4166: Floor 4166: Floor 4166: Floor 4166: Floor 4166: Floor 4166: Floor 4166: Floor 4166:

Floor 4167: a directory of the prior 4166 floors.

063508262023

Floor 4168: A empty room, with a large window and a lone couch. You look out and see the Earth from 17 kilometers up. Being well above the troposphere, you can even see clouds. You sit down on the couch and ponder why you even decided to climb this never-ending skyscraper. Or is it a cosmoscraper? Why are we doing this? What is the point?

Floor 4169: an airlock that leads to an exposed platform. A sign says space jumps!

181708262023
Floor 4170: A jumped space.

Floor 4171: a plaque showing fastest free falls and lowest safe altitude parachute deploys.

234608262023

Floor 4173: a handbook on the history of history museums about the history of museums.

Floor 4174: A faithful recreation of the world in "Fallout New Vegas" You spend a month running around and doing missions.

Floor 4175: a 1:1 recreation of Vana’diel

Floor 4176:  Vana'heim.
Floor 4177: A modded Minecraft world. You spend months in it, building bases, exploring biomes, defeating mobs. But the next floor calls you...

Floor 4178: a single 

221008282023

Floor 4179: Older Minecraft where skeleton horses were plentiful, biomes were small enough so that you could manage to visit them all in one world, mining of iron on a reasonable scale without hitting water filled fissures, was possible. A simpler but more fun version.

Floor 4181: Many teams playing Pictionary. You join in for awhile.
